title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Knicks Survive Jordan’s 52-Point Onslaught to Edge Bulls**

NEW YORK – The Chicago Bulls came to Madison Square Garden, but for 48 minutes, it was Michael Jordan’s personal showcase. In a stunning, historic individual performance, His Airness dropped 52 points against the New York Knicks' vaunted defense. Yet, when the final horn sounded, it was the Knicks who walked off with a hard-fought 97-92 victory.

Jordan was simply sublime, connecting from every conceivable angle against a relentless defensive effort from John Starks and Charles Oakley. He attacked the rim with fury and hit fall-away jumpers with cold-blooded precision, single-handedly keeping the Bulls afloat. The 52-point explosion was a masterpiece of individual brilliance, a testament to Jordan's unassailable greatness.

But basketball is a team game, and on this night, the Knicks’ collective will proved superior. Patrick Ewing anchored the effort with a powerful 24-point, 12-rebound double-double, providing the necessary counter-punch in the post. The true hero, however, was Charles Oakley. Beyond his 17 points, Oakley’s 20 rebounds were a testament to pure grit, and his physical defense, even against an unstoppable force like Jordan, set a defiant tone.

The Knicks’ bench provided the critical difference, with John Starks contributing 14 points and Anthony Mason adding 9, outscoring the Bulls’ reserves and providing vital energy.

In the end, Jordan’s epic scoring barrage was not enough. The Knicks, with a balanced attack and a rebounding advantage, weathered the storm. It was a night where the league’s best player put on a show for the ages, but New York’s toughness and teamwork earned the final, decisive nod.
